intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium subpulliceps, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and yellow-orange composite flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. It is native to Europe and has been introduced to other parts of the world. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural and urban environments.
